Osborne, pulling her sidearm, and PISTOL WHIPPING Dunbar in the head! Dunbar goes sprawling off Hardy as M.P.'s rush into the room, RESTRAINING him. Hardy gets up, gasping, and stumbles to the door.

question: Tom, where are you going-
answer: Home, I'm done.

question: What about the confession?
answer: You want a confession? Why don't you confess, Bill

question: What the hell are you talking about-
answer: I'm talking about West! We had him, Bill, we were there. You're the fucking Base Commander, you knew what he did to Cadets and you let him go on the way he always he has- Styles couldn't reassign him, he's a legend- You knew what he was capable of and you just stood by. It was just a matter of time till somebody fragged his ass, and you know what? He deserved it. There's your confession.

question: I'm talking about West! We had him, Bill, we were there. You're the fucking Base Commander, you knew what he did to Cadets and you let him go on the way he always he has- Styles couldn't reassign him, he's a legend- You knew what he was capable of and you just stood by. It was just a matter of time till somebody fragged his ass, and you know what? He deserved it. There's your confession.
answer: Goddammit, Hardy, you can't just leave-

question: Watch me.
answer: You said you owed Styles and now you're gonna turn your back on him? Hardy whirls on her.

question: West was a monster! Fifteen years ago, I was here, I was Section Eight, I was Pike. Fuck being the knife dummy- that thing he did, stripping Pike down, making him stand outside all night? He did that every year, he did that to me. Fifteen years ago, I wanted him dead, and now I'm supposed to care that somebody offed him? Sorry, no can do. I tried.
answer: You did more than try. You cracked Dunbar in less than three minutes, as an investigator you're phenomenal-

question: Phenomenal at taking bribes, right? A beat. Osborne shakes her head.
answer: I was starting to believe you, you know? That you weren't who everyone Said. I guess I was wrong-

question: Oh, spare me the reverse psychology bullshit! This isn't my "great second chance", Osborne. Everyone thinks I'm a piece of shit cop who took money and nothing is going to change that. Nobody will ever know what happens here-
answer: But you will. Hardy stares at her.

question: Why do you care?
answer: Because it's my job. Because people are dead. Because of the whole honor and duty thing, make a difference in the world, crap like that. We can do this, Hardy. Two and a half hours. That's all I'm asking. Two and a half hours to maybe get the truth. Silence. Hardy looks back up at her. Speaking softly:

question: I didn't shoot West...
answer: What?

question: Just like the first day, huh? You standing guard on me. A CREAKING as the cabin SHIFTS on it's foundation. Dunbar looks up at the roof, scared. It holds. This place ain't gonna hold much longer. Dunbar doesn't reply. Still staring nervously at the roof. Pike looks to make sure the others out of earshot, then: You and me are friends, right? No reply. Right?
answer: Yeah... Pike takes a deep breath.

question: You gotta untie me. I didn't do this thing, Ray.
answer: You hated West more than any of us.

question: Maybe, but that don't make me a killer-
answer: You're the only one missing a grenade.

question: Which anyone coulda taken out of my gear on the chopper. Were you watching your pack on the ride in? Dunbar starts to get up. Ray, this is my life here. I ain't gonna pretend I'm not happy West is gone, but you know I couldn't have done this. It's not in me.
answer: If not you, then who?

question: Mueller.
answer: Oh, come on-

question: We're sweeping our area and suddenly he's gone. Couple minutes later, phosphorous grenade pops off about a third of a click away-
answer: That's exactly what he says about you.

question: Who you gonna trust, Ray? Him or your friend? Dunbar stares at him.
answer: You hated West, Mueller loved him-

question: Enough to go to prison? Childs' PX Scam, Mueller was in on it-
answer: Bullshit.

question: Look in my pack.
answer: Why?

question: Just look. Little pocket. Dunbar walks over to Pike's pack and unzips it. Checks the little pocket. Pulls out a VIAL and a SYRINGE. Combat grade morphine. Mueller sold it to me. .
answer: You're lying-

question: Why... why didn't you tell me?
answer: Becoming a morphine addict during Basic ain't exactly something you want to broadcast. Only Mueller and Childs know. A beat. Dunbar gets to his feet.

question: That still doesn't mean you didn't kill him.
answer: You saw West, right? How was he killed?

question: Full clip to the body-
answer: From up close or far away?

question: His chest was hamburger-
answer: That's close range. You go full auto on a guy from close range, you're gonna be swimming in blood. Look at my uniform. Nothing. Dunbar looks. Not a speck of blood on it. And where's Mueller's? When I came in, he was only wearing a t-shirt. Dunbar looks over to fireplace, where ashes are smoldering... FLASHCUT TO - When Dunbar first entered the Cabin Way I figure it, West must have found out about their little business and was gonna bust them, so they decided to get rid of him first...

question: They?
answer: Mueller and Childs. One of them must've taken the grenade from my pack on the chopper... Then Mueller ditches me during the exercise and heads for the creek. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- CREEK BED,-- EARLIER LAST NIGHT Mueller stands on the hill and pulls the grenades pin, tossing it down the embankment. .. He blows the grenade to frame me and gets West to come running... . The grenade BLOWS, setting the entire area AGLOW...

question: I... I don't know...
answer: What don't you know?

question: This is a lot of information to be Getting... I have to think-
answer: There's no time to think, Ray, we gotta get out of here! You untie me, we grab the guns, get Kendall and Nunez, and make a run for it-

question: No... no, we can just wait till we get back and then tell the M.P.'s-
answer: We wait and I'm a dead man. I got a black face, a criminal record, and over a hundred other cadets who'll testify how much I hated West - my court martial will take six minutes. It's either me or them, Ray, and you gotta decide right now. The cabin SHIFTS again. Dunbar stares at him. Untie me. Dunbar doesn't move. Untie me, Ray. A long beat. The two men stare at each other. And then Dunbar pulls his knife from his boot and leans down to cut Pike's bonds. Thank God. . .

question: We all know what you did, Pike. I don't know what kind of nigger voodoo You been working in here, but-
answer: Where's your shirt, Mueller?

question: Used it to start the fire-
answer: Still got mine on, not a speck of blood on it. Not a bad trick for a murderer- you said you burned yours? The others begin to look at Mueller with new eyes.

question: To start a fire, goddammit! What about him, huh? Maybe he offed the Sarge and changed shirts, brought an extra one in his pack. Y'ever think of that? Go ahead, cut him loose! First chance he gets, he'll waste the rest of us, that's how they work- The hurricane, reaching FEVER PITCH outside as WATER begins leaking in through the roof.
answer: Goddammit, Ray, we gotta get out of Here-

question: We're not going anywhere. PIKE TURNS TO MUELLER:
answer: Cadet Michael Mueller, I hereby place you under military arrest for the Murder of Sergeant Nathan West-

question: The fuck are you talking about-
answer: You are to be stripped of all weapons And placed under guard-

question: Bullshit-
answer: Until we return to base, and ballistics can match your weapon to the slugs in Sergeant West's body-

question: But not Pike's. Osborne hands him the coffee.
answer: Why didn't you tell us all this in the first place?

question: Would you have believed me? Their faces say "no". Osborne spreads a MAP out on the table.
answer: Where's the cabin?

question: Talk it through
answer: And they're smart about it. They know when you commit a crime you know is going to be investigated, you need a fall guy and for that to work, you have to have a witness.

question: Dunbar.
answer: Exactly, someone who's not involved, who's word can't be questioned. You only let them see what you want them to see, you make them believe, so when the time comes, they've totally bought into your version of events.

question: They believe the innocent are guilty and the guilty are innocent.
answer: And if they're asked, that's what they'll tell the, world.

question: So it's a good plan but it goes wrong; Mueller flips out and shoots their fall guy, which means they have to bring Dunbar and Kendall into the Cover story-
answer: Kendall maybe would have agreed, but The hurricane buttfucks the cabin-

question: Buttfucks the cabin?
answer: And all hell breaks loose. A lot of Good guys shoot a lot of bad guys and whiz, bang, zoom, happy ending.

question: So why, after Dunbar drags Kendall out from under a house, does the Senator's son try and get us to put his savior in the gas chamber?
answer: That bugs you too?

question: Little bit.
answer: Let's go talk to Bill...

question: Let's go talk to Bill...
answer: Fucking asthma... This whole thing's driving it nuts. A beat.

question: What I said before-
answer: Was dead right. You think Dunbar's on the level?

question: Yeah.
answer: Does Osborne agree?

question: You want Kendall, don't you?
answer: He tried to burn Dunbar to us. You don't do that if you're not involved. Hardy nods, agreeing. Styles stares at them.

question: You both know if you do this, if you go after a Senator's son and you're wrong... it's not just me in the hot seat anymore.
answer: We know.

question: Not much time to solve the crime. Tell me, detective, how did it feel taking blood money from Guissepe Torres? Did it weigh on your conscience or did you just not think about it?
answer: You tried to pin three stone murders on Dunbar-

question: How many murders did you cover up? One? Five? Maybe an even ten.
answer: Can I go to jail for punching a guy who's been shot?

question: I think they're giving me the wrong medicine. This isn't a very good Hospital, you know- Epileptic attacks are murder on your system. Rattle your internal organs like a paint mixer.
answer: My heart weeps. He returns with a GLASS OF WATER and hands it to Kendall.

question: Then he's mistaken. You know, I really don't think my father would approve of this line of questioning-
answer: Why did you tell us he shot everybody, Levi? You put him in for three murders, the man saved your life-

question: So I should stay silent about his misdeeds? The guns went off, I ran in, Childs shot me, Pike and Mueller were dead, and Dunbar was running out the door with the smoking gun-
answer: Dunbar was running out the door? Ohhhhhh... See that's where I was confused, because I thought you said Nunez was running out the door.

question: No. I said Dunbar.
answer: Huh. You know, I really thought you said Nunez. I thought you said "Dunbar was gone," My fault, I gotta check the tape on that. Oh, yeah we taped the last interview. This one too. Cause it'd be a real break for us to catch you in a lie. Silence. They wait for Kendall's reaction. He looks momentarily flustered by this... and then he smiles.

question: I believe your next line is "What are you trying to hide?"
answer: Well?

question: Sorry to disappoint. I'm on painkillers for the injury - they cloud the mind. You're right, it was Nunez. Any more questions? Hardy doesn't know what to say. That was his ace card. Don't get me wrong, Mueller and Childs were quite the pair, the type of guys you didn't feel comfortable going to sleep around. Completely capable of murder. But as I said, I didn't hear the exchange before the shooting. I wasn't in the room. Osborne furrows her brow at this as Hardy continues.
answer: Dunbar will testify that you were.

question: I need to talk to you outside.
answer: We're fucked, I know-

question: They got their stories straight.
answer: What?

question: What Kendall said - "the type of guys you don't feel comfortable going to sleep around." That's what Dunbar said about Childs to the letter.
answer: Are you sure?

question: Positive. Hardy, they planned this. She grins. He grins back. Not bad for hostile and uncooperative, eh?
answer: Something funny, Levi?

question: See, I just take your gun to the morgue and fire it into one of their skulls; then I call every newspaper in the country with the story about how Senator Kendall's gay son went nuts on a training mission-
answer: It won't work-

question: It will and you know why? Because you're not a person anymore, you're a cadet in the United States Army; you have no identity, no Miranda warning, and no rights. So I'm gonna throw you to the wolves, and unlike you I'm gonna get away with it, because you're pissing me off! She finishes, breathing hard. Kendall, totally cowed. Hardy, trying to suppress a smile. Osborne rises for the door. Enjoy your flight to Washington-
answer: Wait-

question: What. Silence. Kendall takes a deep breath.
answer: Dunbar's telling the truth.

question: Wrong answer-
answer: We did get our stories straight, but not because we killed anyone. It was because I threatened him.

question: Childs did it, huh? Kendall nods, still a little teary. First Pike, then Mueller, now Childs? When are we getting to the others? When are we gonna hear about Nunez? FLASHCUT TO - NUNEZ, in the creek bed, SHOOTING WEST. Or Dunbar? FLASHCUT TO - Now DUNBAR, SHOOTING WEST. Or you, Levi? When is it finally going to come out that you were the one who killed him? FLASHCUT TO - KENDALL, SHOOTING WEST.
answer: I didn't-

question: But you can't prove it! You can't prove anything until we find the bodies! Kendall, crying harder now, beginning to shake. You lied to us, Levi, you're going to the gas chamber unless you tell us where to find them!
answer: I don't know-

question: Where are they!
answer: Maybe-

question: I pushed him too hard.
answer: You couldn't have known-

question: Yeah, I could've. Should've.
answer: You wanted to get the truth.

question: No, I didn't. I wanted to humiliate him. For what he did to Dunbar. For fucking over the little guy.
answer: You mean the falsely accused? Hardy looks up at her and nods. You wanted to break him.

question: Yeah.
answer: So did I. She looks back to the floor. Hardy takes a drag from the cigarette, and then tosses that away too. The door opens and Styles walks into the room. Somber.

question: Gets on his plane in ten minutes, which means you two are done. You'll understand if I don't walk you out. Hardy gets up to go and then stops. Realizing something.
answer: They're taking your command, aren't they?

question: The Senator... He points to Kendall's hospital room.
answer: I'm sorry, Bill.

question: Don't be. I'm not cut out to deal with the West's of the world.
answer: You're a good soldier, Bill.

question: I thought you said that wasn't a compliment. Hardy smiles.
answer: This time it is.

question: This time it is.
answer: Your car's in the motor pool. I'll walk you over. They walk in silence, for a bit. So what now?

question: Now I go home, get drunk, and try and forget this ever happened.
answer: Think it'll work?

question: Nah. They pass a GROUP OF CADETS doing drills. Hardy, watching them. Almost looking wistful.
answer: You know, you never told me why you left the army.

question: It dawned on me one day that we were supposed to be a nation founded on the principle of questioning authority... and all I did here was follow orders. It didn't add up.
answer: For what?

question: That's gonna stay my secret.
answer: We were close to something with Kendall.

question: Maybe... Maybe we were nowhere near. Sometimes mysteries stay mysteries. I haven't by any chance grown on you, have I?
answer: No.

question: Good, just making sure. Osborne turns to the DUTY SERGEANT.
answer: We're going need a vehicle release. The Sergeant nods, walking up with a clipboard.

question: Did I ever claim I was Raymond Dunbar? Was I ever told to state my name rank and serial number for the record? No. You assumed who I was, because I was wearing this uniform. Don't believe me? He reaches under the table and rips out the HIDDEN MICROPHONE. Check your tapes. Hardy and Osborne exchange an uneasy glance.
answer: We don't need the tapes-

question: Oh, you don't? What else do you have on me? You haven't found any bodies yet, have you?
answer: We've found all of them.

question: He took his gun. Used it on Childs. Nunez spins, seeing CHILDS BEHIND HIM. He DIVES as Childs fires! Hits the ground in a roll, comes up with Mueller's rifle, and SHOOTS - BLOWING CHILDS BACK against the wet rocks. I can't imagine what it was like. Having your friends try to kill you... Nunez slumps against the gully's wall, breathing hard. In agony over what he's just had to do. But you do what you have to survive. Closing his eyes, Nunez steels himself. Wipes the blood from his hands and climbs out of the gully. Kendall and I found Dunbar a couple minutes later. TIME CUT TO It came to me in a split second. Change clothes, change identities. If James Pike gets discharged he goes right back to jail. But if I was Dunbar, I could walk away from all this with a new life. But then... As he reaches down for the uniform, a SHOT RINGS OUT.
answer: Put it down! A Mexican stand-off. The rain continues to fall.

question: I just want to go! Nunez shakes his head.
answer: You were gonna kill me, Pike! Thought you were my friend! Dunbar, torn. He can't bring himself to shoot, but he can't surrender either.

question: I have to get Kendall to a hospital!
answer: He was gonna kill me too! Silence. The two men still facing each other. NUNEZ {CONT'D) I snapped Mueller's neck! He was my best friend and I had to snap his neck because he was gonna shoot me for drugs! For West!

question: We don't have to do this! You go that way, I'll go this way! Nunez laughs.
answer: You'll shoot me in the back!

question: You killed three people! Isn't that enough for one night? More silence. Neither moves. The sky above, a maelstrom. I don't want to die out here, Roberto! Do you? Nunez, staring at him. Deciding.
answer: If you even twitch... Dunbar nods. Nunez begins backing away, rifle still trained on him. And then Dunbar spies something behind and to the left of Nunez... West. Staring down at him from behind some brush. Watching. Nunez, slowly backing away. He pauses as his foot catches on a fallen branch. Looks away from Dunbar for a split second to step over it... West nods to Dunbar as if to say "Go on. . . "

question: Just four people MIA. Silence.
answer: You'll testify to this, the corruption, the drug scam? We can cut a deal for you on the Nunez killing.

question: I don't want any deals.
answer: If you're telling the truth, the PX requisition records will prove it-

question: All the proof you need will be when West comes back and puts a bullet in my brain. But I'll do it. I'm a dead man, anyway. Like Kendall. We both should have died out there with our brothers. I know that now. Silence. The JAG Lawyer looks to Hardy, all anger gone.
answer: I'll take him now if you don't mind. Hardy nods. Dunbar rises and slowly walks to the door. Turning back to Hardy.

question: We need to talk-
answer: Seven. He takes a slug of his drink.

question: What?
answer: Seven guys. What was it you said? You were "just starting to believe I wasn't the guy people said". He chuckles. HARDY {CONT'D) Seven. That's the answer to Kendall's question. How many? Seven. Osborne looks at him. Realizing what he's saying.

question: This isn't the time-
answer: This is the perfect time. You know what makes a good detective? The number of confessions they get. You're a good detective, Osborne. So now you get mine.

question: What if I don't want it?
answer: Tough. He pours himself another drink. Thing about taking money is, you don't have to do anything. You just sit there. Maybe you don't return a phone call. Maybe you don't follow up a lead. But that's it. Keep the money, your work's done. Osborne stares at him. Seven unsolved murders. And you know what? It didn't weigh on my conscience. Not one goddamn bit. He takes a slug from his glass and grimaces.

question: That's not true.
answer: There are degrees of truth, officer. Always degrees.

question: You're a good man, Hardy.
answer: Really.

question: Far as I'm concerned, whatever you did in the past can stay in the past. Hardy stares at her.
answer: I may not be growing on you, but you're sure as hell growing on me. He motions to the bartender for another glass, but Osborne takes his hand, stopping him.

question: And because you're a good man, I know you'll do the right thing. Hardy looks at her, questioning. Osborne takes a deep breath. Pike never made it to D.C.. Somebody took him off the plane before it left. My guess is he's already dead. Hardy stares at her.
answer: West?

question: Nobody saw. But I don't think so. She puts the papers on the bar. These are the requisitions from the PX, the ones used to release the drugs to Mueller. West signed half of them - Pike was telling the truth. Look who signed the other half. She taps the bottom of the paper. Hardy, not wanting to believe it. He looks up at her, pained.
answer: Do I have a choice in this?

question: Yeah. I can wait till you're off the base and do it myself.
answer: Fuck it. Let's go finish this. "You have to get out of the way of the bigger dogs". That was good. Styles squints at the figure.

question: Fuck it. Let's go finish this. "You have to get out of the way of the bigger dogs". That was good. Styles squints at the figure.
answer: Tom, is that you? Hardy steps forward, into the office.

question: It was so good, I actually forgot you're one of the bigger dogs now. The Base Commander. The one in control. You couldn't let him testify, could you?
answer: What are you talking about?

question: If you let him testify then it would have all come out. West was supposed to take care of it out there, shut Nunez up and then disappear. But it got messy and people got killed. So you called your old pal Tom Hardy, figuring if worse came to worse, he'd cover for you.
answer: You're drunk-

question: I'm not going to cover for you, Bill. Not for this. Styles, realizing what Hardy's talking about.
answer: Look- He begins to move from behind his desk.

question: Stay where you are.
answer: Or what? You've gone round the bend-

question: West had a partner. Someone who knew how to get things done. What I can't understand is why you signed these. If you'd just let West take care of the paperwork, no one would have known, but you got careless. So when Pike finally told the truth you had to get rid of him, too.
answer: That's preposterous-

question: Toxicology report came back. Kendall's attack was caused by a drug known as anephadrine, maybe you've heard of it. It's for asthmatics. If an epileptic takes enough, it kills them. I checked with the nurses at the hospital - you're the only other person who visited Kendall.
answer: Wanted to see if he was okay-

question: You poisoned him, Bill. You heard our interrogation, you knew he was ready to crack, so you killed him, just like Pike.
answer: I'm not even going to dignify that-

question: No! You will stand there and you will listen! What happened to you, Bill? You were the one who joined up to do good in the world. You were the one who believed in it-
answer: You want to get into a finger pointing contest about character? The army kicked you out for drugs, the cops fired you for taking bribes from a mobster, and you think you can stand there and lecture me on codes of conduct? There's only one criminal standing in this room and it's you.

question: Not for long. He walks towards the desk. No more witnesses. West's a ghost. But it doesn't matter because we have your signature, the hospital log, and Kendall's toxicology report. And that'll be enough.
answer: You're crazy-

question: You can't duck this, Bill. I may have done every goddamn thing in my life wrong but I won't let this happen.
answer: For the last time, I have no idea what you're talking about-

question: Get your hands away from the desk! In the darkness we see Styles MOVE SUDDENLY... Osborne, gun! Hardy DIVES to the floor - Osborne in the doorway, PISTOL raised, FIRES TWO SHOTS! Muzzle flare lighting the room for a split second as Styles is BLOWN BACK against the wall! Hardy gets to his feet and flicks on the LIGHT. Styles lies slumped in the corner, two holes in his chest. Dead. Osborne lowers her weapon, shaking. Hardy points to the top desk drawer, which is open. Inside it sits an IVORY HANDLED PISTOL. Fully loaded, safety off. It's presence tells them everything they need to know.
answer: It's West's, isn't it? Hardy nods and then turns to look down at Styles' body.

question: Now it's over.
answer: What are you doing out here?

question: Leaving without saying goodbye. What are you gonna do?
answer: Go home, get drunk, and try and forget this ever happened.

question: Think it'll work?
answer: Nah.

question: Want company? Osborne smiles.
answer: A word of advice about women - that first hour or so after they kill their boss? Probably not the best time to hit on them.

question: I should probably write that down.
answer: Yeah. . Hardy pulls a card from his pocket and hands it to her. Your phone number?

question: In case you need me to testify about the shooting. They'll clear you. A beat.
answer: He was your friend.

question: Yeah. But he was a lot of other things, too. Thanks. She nods. An awkward moment. Finally: I'll see you. He turns away. Walking towards his car.
answer: Hey, Hardy! He turns back. She walks up and holds something out to him. A ten dollar bill. I owe you this. He looks down at the money.

question: Stem to sternum. You taught me well, Sarge. And WEST DIES. A moment of utter silence and then VOICES FROM THE PAST begin coming back to us:
answer: You think you could explain all this to me? Kendall walks over to Hardy and hands him a PISTOL.

question: I wouldn't know where to start. Kendall holds out his arm, gritting his teeth... I guess it was about one man framing another... When you commit a crime you know is going to be investigated, you need a fall guy.. .
answer: The one who won't talk was trading live fire with the dead one as we reached the pick-up.

question: And if they're asked, that's what they'll tell the world.
answer: Your greatest weapon will by your allies . . .

question: My brand. Must be my lucky day.
answer: . . . some of which you may have to sacrifice for the greater good. Hardy, secretly dissolving a POWDER into Kendall's water.

question: We got the toxicology report . . .
answer: Make no mistake, the innocent will die. . . Osborne, FIRING TWICE into Styles. As he hits the wall

question: Next time you frame a guy, pick someone who can't defend themselves... But it will not be in vain. Sometimes, you can trick the enemy into doing your work for you. . . Osborne, staring down at WEST'S PISTOL. He still carry those guns?
answer: ...if you engage in a clever enough subterfuge.
